title: Naming Varaible
text: First, we need to identify our variables: $$a=1$$, $$b=5$$, and $$c=1$$
speech: First, we need to identify our variables:  a is equal to 1 ,  b, is equal to 5 , and  c, is equal to 1
pacedSpeech: First, we need to identify our variables:   a is equal to 1

title: Quadratic Formula
text: Now we can plug our variables into the Quadratic Formula: $$\frac{\left(-b\pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}\right)}{2} a$$ becomes $$\frac{\left(-5\pm \sqrt{5^2-4\times1\times1}\right)}{2\times1}$$.
speech: Now we can plug our variables into the Quadratic Formula:  fraction, parentheses negative b plus or minus the square root of b squared minus 4 a c end root , over 2,  a  becomes  fraction, parentheses negative 5 plus or minus the square root of 5 squared minus, 4 times 1 times 1 end root , over, 2 times 1,  .

title: Smplifying
text: This simplies to our final answers: $$\frac{\left(-5+\sqrt{21}\right)}{2}$$ and $$\frac{\left(-5-\sqrt{21}\right)}{2}$$.
speech: This simplies to our final answers:  fraction, parentheses, negative 5 plus the square root of 21 , over 2,   and  fraction, parentheses, negative 5 minus the square root of 21 , over 2,  .
